title.narrative: Humanitarian Response for Refugees influx in Tanzania

description.narrative: To provide the required Water Sanitation and Hygiene (WASH) infrastructure and materials for and mobilise up to 200,000 new Burundian and Congolese refugees in Nyarugusu and Nduta refugee camps, and 15,000 people in the nearby host community to make effective use of provided facilities, knowledge and tools to protect themselves from WASH related diseases. Oxfam will also provide targeted Emergency Food Security and Vulnerable Livelihood (EFSVL) interventions including, Cash transfer, IGAs, Kitchen gardening, value chains and support to markets. Capacity building of Local Non Governmental Organisation (LNGO) partners will also be a priority
